Column Comment.0: NODE IDENTIFIER: Unique identification number assigned to a specific point (node)
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: NODE OBSERVATION NUMBER: A observation number used to differentiatebetween versions of the coordinates of a specific node.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: AREA ID: Unique identifier for any named area such as a country, province, projectarea, area of interest, offshore area, district etc.
Column Comment.5: AREA TYPE: Unique identifier for the type of area, such as country, state, AOI etc.
Column Comment.6: COORDINATE QUALITY: the quality of the coordiante, such as validated,unvalidated, poor etc.
Column Comment.7: COORD ACQUISITION: identifies an assembly of coordinate data that must begrouped together. It should be acquired together at the same time, from the samesource, using the same method and at the same accuracy. May be used to indicatethe level of accuracy of a set of coordinates.
Column Comment.8: EASTING: The X coordinate for the node with respect to the point of origin of thespecified map projection.
Column Comment.9: EASTING OUOM: Original unit of measure for the Easting value.
Column Comment.10: EFFECTIVE DATE: Date on which the well node version became effective.
Column Comment.11: ELEVATION: The elevation of the node relative to the well datum (usually Mean SeaLevel), Used when the node position is the Surface Location.
Column Comment.12: ELEVATION OUOM: Original unit of measure for the Elevation.
Column Comment.13: EAST-WEST DIRECTION: A reference table identifying valid East-West directions.For example, East, West.
Column Comment.14: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.15: COORDINATE SYSTEM ID: unique identifier for the coordinate system.
Column Comment.16: LATITUDE: Angular distance in decimal degrees, north or south of the equator. Apositive value represents a north latitude.
Column Comment.17: LEGAL SURVEY TYPE: The survey type used for legal descriptions. For example,Carter, Congressional, Dominion Land Survey, ...
Column Comment.18: LOCAL COORDINATE SYSTEM IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the localcoordinate system, such as a local grid system (ATS, STS, MTS etc) to which thesecoordinates have been referenced. Coordinates that are referenced to a localcoordinate system are usually surveyed relative to the local system using metes andbounds or local survey references; maintaining the position of each point relative toits referenced local system is very important to survey accuracy.
Column Comment.19: LOCATION QUALIFIER: A description of the type of location. For example, Actual,Theoretical, Original, Contract, ... (but not Rationalized).
Column Comment.20: LOCATION QUALITY: Indicates the quality or degree of reliablity of a location.
Column Comment.21: LOCATION TYPE: A reference table identifying the type of obj ect being given a legallocation. For example, node, well, ...
Column Comment.22: LONGITUDE: Angular distance in decimal degrees, east or west of the primemeridian of the Geodetic Datum. A negative value represents west longitude.
Column Comment.23: COORDINATE SYSTEM ID: unique identifier for the coordinate system.
Column Comment.24: MEASURED DEPTH: The depth measured along the wellbore path relative to theMeasurement Datum specified in the well row. Used for downhole node positionvalues.
Column Comment.25: MEASURED DEPTH OUOM: Measured depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.26: MONUMENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identification number assigned to the monument.
Column Comment.27: MONUMENT SUPPORT FACILITY SUBTYPE: part of the FK from SF MONUMENT.
Column Comment.28: NODE POSITION: The position on a wellbore path. For example: surface point,bottomhole point, kick-off point, ....
Column Comment.29: NORTHING: The Y coordinate for the node location with respect to the point of originof the specified map projection.
Column Comment.30: NORTHING OUOM: Original unit of measure for the Northing value.
Column Comment.31: NORTH TYPE: The North reference used in surveying to define angularmeasurements. For example, True North, Magnetic North, Grid North, AstronomicalNorth, ...
Column Comment.32: NORTH-SOUTH DIRECTION: A reference table identifying valid north-southDirections. For example, North, South.
Column Comment.33: ORIGINAL XY UNITS OF MEASURE: The units of measure for the original version ofthe node coordinates
Column Comment.34: PLATFORM IDENTIFIER: Unique number assigned to the offshore drilling platformor onshore drilling pad..
Column Comment.35: PLATFORM SF SUBTYPE: part of the FK reference from SF PLATFORM.
Column Comment.36: POLAR AZIMUTH: Value for the azimuth direction of polar offset, measured inangular degrees with a clockwise offset from true (geographic) north.
Column Comment.37: POLAR OFFSET: The map distance from the surface location to a point above thebottom hole location
Column Comment.38: POLAR OFFSET OUOM: Polar offset original unit of measure.
Column Comment.39: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.40: PREFERRED INDICAATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that this column is a preferredlocation version.
Column Comment.41: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.42: REPORTED TRUE VERTICAL DEPTH: The reported straight line depth of the nodemeasured relative to the Measurement Datum specified in the Well row.
Column Comment.43: REPORTED TRUE VERTICAL DEPTH OUOM: True vertical depth original unit ofmeasure.
Column Comment.44: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.45: VERSION TYPE: the type of well node version, such as actual, theoretical, orginal,agreed, rational etc.
Column Comment.46: X OFFSET: Offset distance, in the east/west (X) direction from the surface location ofthe well. Used when the node position is a downhole point and the well is deviated.
Column Comment.47: X OFFSET OUOM: X distance original unit of measure.
Column Comment.48: Y OFFSET: Distance, In the north/south (Y) direction from the surface of the well.Used for a downhole node position and for deviated wells.
Column Comment.49: Y OFFSET OUOM: Y distance original unit of measure.
Column Comment.50: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.51: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.52: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.53: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.54: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.55: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.56: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
